intro: Podocarpus epiphyticus, commonly known as the epiphytic podocarp, is a species of flowering plant in the Podocarpaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found growing on the trunks and branches of trees as an epiphyte. The plant has leathery, evergreen leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers and develops woody cones that contain its seeds. Due to its unique growth habit and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in shaded garden environments.
